channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023080168
item.description:
Report X-2023080168

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: TRENTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents shifted in shipping box causing Rapicide Part B 5L jug to have loose cap. Package was placed in RED Tote immediately upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Contents shifted in shipping box causing Rapicide Part B 5L jug to have loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in RED Tote immediately upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023071198
item.description:
Report X-2023071198

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVER NIGHT SORT THE DAMAGE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING SIGNS OF LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION 1 BOTTLE OF ACETIC ACID GALCIAL WAS FOUND CRACKED AND CONTENTS LEAKED OUT. THE REAMINS WAS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: THE CAUSE OF FAILURE WAS DUE TO IMPROPER HANDLING WHILE UNLOADING. THE BOX FELL AND THE BOTTLE INSIDE CRACKED ALLOWING ALL THE LIQUID TO BE LEAKED OUT. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS OF ACETIC ACID GALCIAL WAS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION

  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered inside WA 246. Manager Miles McGowan contained and cleaned the leaking liquid. DescribePack: Liquid appears to be leaking only from around the cap of one of the gallon jugs. There does not seem to be an inciting incident. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area was cleaned, package was placed in a container to prevent further spillage

item.title: Report E-2023070901
item.description:
Report E-2023070901

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: JERSEY CITY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 12, 2023, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN3149 was damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted surfaces. MEG personnel noted one (1) empty gallon of UN3149 with residual material released to the surrounding cargo. The crew deployed absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to collect all UN3149-impacted materials into two (2) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. MEG personnel noted that no further actions were required on site and crews demobilized.

item.title: Report X-2023071191
item.description:
Report X-2023071191

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON UNLOADING THE PACKAGE, A PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET AND NOTIFIED A MANAGER. HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG AND HAZMAT TOTE AND BROUGHT DOWN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND PROCESSED. DescribePack: ONE OF THE BOTTLES OF THE SYSMEX WRIGHT STAIN HAD A CRACK BEHIND THE HANDLE AT THE SEAM OF THE BOTTLE. IT LEAKED OUT SOILING THE OTHER BOTTLES AND OUTER PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG AND HAZMAT TOTE. THEN BROUGHT DOWN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND WAS PROCESSED.

item.title: Report X-2023071168
item.description:
Report X-2023071168

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE BOX WAS NOTICED TO BE WET BY THE MANAGER AND THEN PROMPTLY TAKEN OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO BE SECURED AND VENTILATED. i WAS THEN NOTIFIED THAT I HAD A BOX WAITING FOR ME IN THE HAZMAT CAGE. i QUICKLY WENT OVER TO THE CAGE AND REPACKED SAID PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM PROPERLY AND SAFELY AND AM NOW WAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: APPROXIMATELY 1/4 CUP HAD LEAKED OUT OF ONE CONTAINER OF THE PART B SOLUTION DUE TO A LOOSE CAP ON JUST THAT ONE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: QUICKLY TAKING PACKAGE OVER TO HAZMAT CAGE TO VENTILATE AND ALSO REPACKING SECURELY INTO A YELLOW DRUM.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one metal 55 gallon drum of butyl acetates (un1123) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.description:
Report X-2023080121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-19
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found in the QA damaged bin with the arrows facing up in the QA damaged area. There were no consequences caused by this hazardous material. DescribePack: 1 PLASTIC BOTTLE WITH LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: it was brought to the hazmat cage in the back in the hazmat bin
